verse: Then the Lord said to me: “Even if Moses and Samuel ·prayed for them [stood before me], ·I [my soul] would not ·feel sorry for the people of Judah [turn toward this people; Moses and Samuel interceded on behalf of their sinful generations; Ex. 32:11–14, 30–34; Num. 14:13–19; 1 Sam. 7:5–11; 12:17–23]. Send them away from me! Tell them to go!
When they ask you, ‘Where will we go?’ tell them: ‘This is what the Lord says:

“I will ·send [appoint] four kinds of destroyers against them,” says the Lord. “I will send ·war [the sword] to kill, dogs to drag the bodies away, and the birds of the ·air [sky; heavens] and ·wild animals [beasts of the land] to eat and destroy the bodies.

I will make them [the people of Judah] ·hated by [a horror to] everyone on earth because of what Manasseh did in Jerusalem. (Manasseh son of Hezekiah was king of the nation of Judah [from 698–642 bc; he was a particularly wicked king; 2 Kin. 21:1–18; 23:26–27].)
